pr_title: GEODE-7914: create missing unit test for Redis Module Expire Command

timeline.message: GEODE-7914: create missing unit test for Redis Module Expire Command

timeline.bodyText: This and import org.apache.geode.redis.internal.executor.string.GetRangeExecutor are unused according to spotless
timeline.author: moleske

replies.bodyText: yeah, I confess I was soling on this at the end of the day and couldn't remember how to run spotless.  We'll catch it next commit!
replies.author: jhutchison

replies.bodyText: ./gradlew spotlessApply will auto apply the fixes it can (like removing imports)
replies.author: moleske

timeline.bodyText: The default for verify is times(1), so you can remove the explicit times(1) (same for the tests below)
timeline.author: moleske

replies.bodyText: In the past I've adopted a sort of informal convention of leaving  the (unneeded) times(1) in there to  make it really obvious what's going on (in case a reader is not familiar with the default value), but not sure if that actually improves readability or not?  thoughts....?
replies.author: jhutchison

replies.bodyText: Oh that's interesting.  I haven't run into that, mostly because I rarely want a test to verify something happens multiple times.  I will say when I looked through the test, I was like "Well that's interesting, there's a times, wonder why" and then saw "oh its one, that's boring."  So I guess seeing verify with a times is a trigger for me to look closer since it is not doing the normal just one time.  I'm not that strong against it which is why I marked the PR as approved.  Don't want to block good tests on something minor.  I think in the Geode code base we've only put times(someNumber) when that number is not one if you were to go looking in Geode for prior art.
replies.author: moleske

replies.bodyText: yeah, makes sense.  Will take into consideration in future verifies :)   thanks for the feedback
replies.author: jhutchison

timeline.message: empty commit to trigger CI build
